reasoning: Benign pheochromocytomas represent ~90% of all pheochromocytomas (total incidence ~0.8 per 100k). Estimated at 0.7 per 100k based on endocrine tumor registry data.
source: Beard CM et al. (1983). Occurrence of pheochromocytoma in Rochester, Minnesota, 1950-1979. Mayo Clin Proc. 58:802-804
